entry.title: Chinese have had enough of Zero Covid, they are fighting back

media:group.media:title: Chinese have had enough of Zero Covid, they are fighting back
media:group.media:description:
The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) may be unable to maintain the ‘zero-COVID’ policy because it is facing an increasingly violent wave of protests from the people.
Sound of Hope reported that a protest against the CCP’s harsh anti-epidemic policy broke out in Wuhan City on the evening of November 3. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: China’s exports grow at two-digit rate now, but Barclays expects 2-5% drop in 2023

media:group.media:title: China’s exports grow at two-digit rate now, but Barclays expects 2-5% drop in 2023
media:group.media:description:
Exports remain a key pillar of China’s economy, but its outlook is turning bleak according to Barclays, one of the largest banks in Europe. According to its latest report released on November 2, Barclays expected that China’s exports will drop between 2% and 5% next year, a downgrade from its previous forecast for 1% growth.
------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: China’s venture funding falls sharply after clampdown

media:group.media:title: China’s venture funding falls sharply after clampdown
media:group.media:description: China's venture capital (VC) investments this year have plunged significantly, making it the world's worst performer amid the brutal crackdown of the communist regime and the tech industry downturn. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Celebrities are leaving China: So begins a new migration wave?

media:group.media:title: Celebrities are leaving China: So begins a new migration wave?
media:group.media:description: After the national congress, news of a celebrity migration from mainland society spread widely. Their reputations make their moving create a specific influence on Chinese culture. Public opinion is that they are not optimistic about China’s prospects under CCP rule, and their departure is likely to lead to the fourth wave of immigration since the CCP’s Cultural Revolution. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: China's ‘Zero-COVID’ policies continue to strongly impact its economy

media:group.media:title: China's ‘Zero-COVID’ policies continue to strongly impact its economy
media:group.media:description:
As COVID cases increase in numerous major cities throughout China, the country is battling its worst outbreak since the summer.
As a result, millions of citizens are being asked to stay at home or taken to centralized quarantine facilities per the nation’s strict ‘zero-COVID’ policy. It has had a significant impact on business operations in China. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Lockdowns around world's largest iPhone; China lies about economic data, overstates GDP by a third

media:group.media:title: Lockdowns around world's largest iPhone; China lies about economic data, overstates GDP by a third
media:group.media:description: 0:00 highlights 0:32 China locks down surrounding areas around world's largest iPhone factory 1:35 Apple supplier Foxconn quadruples bonuses to lure back fleeing workers 3:45 34,000 tourists detained at Shanghai Disneyland because of 1 positive COVID case 5:35 Study: China lies about economic data, overstates GDP growth by a third 7:18 Chinese market goes ‘super bull’ after mysterious screenshot spreads like wildfire ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Beijing’s environmental destruction: long legacy exposed, journalist

media:group.media:title: Beijing’s environmental destruction: long legacy exposed, journalist
media:group.media:description: At the recent CCP's 20th National Congress, China's ruling government said that it had done a better job of protecting the environment over the past ten years. A Chinese investigative reporter exposed the opposite picture of a badly damaged China's ecosystem that might not get better for decades. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Hundreds of millions invested ‘pig hotels’ in the hope of satisfying food demands in China

media:group.media:title: Hundreds of millions invested ‘pig hotels’ in the hope of satisfying food demands in China
media:group.media:description:
Over the past three years, farmers across China have invested billions of dollars in huge, high-rise pig facilities.
Zhongxin Kaiwei Industrial Pig Farm, located in Ezhou City, Hubei Province, is equipped with many intelligent systems for automatic operation. The farm, dubbed the Pig's Palace, opened earlier this month with a capacity of 650,000 pigs. With two 26-story buildings, it is currently the tallest pig farm in the world. When fully operational, the farm can process 100,000 tons of meat per year. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: China might face extreme winter drought: Weather scientist warns

media:group.media:title: China might face extreme winter drought: Weather scientist warns
media:group.media:description: On Thursday, a Chinese weather scientist warned that southern China's southern provinces might face a drought in the winter. It could hurt the hydropower generation supply to meet high electricity demand during winter. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Tiger Global pauses new stock investments in China

media:group.media:title: Tiger Global pauses new stock investments in China
media:group.media:description: Tiger Global Management is pulling back new investments in Chinese equities as it reviews exposure to the country. According to the Wall Street Journal, the New York-based investing powerhouse watches Beijing’s tendency to heighten geopolitical tensions and continue its stringent zero-COVID policy. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: CCP's attempt to rewrite the international order needs to be stopped: former U.S. official

media:group.media:title: CCP's attempt to rewrite the international order needs to be stopped: former U.S. official
media:group.media:description: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen received foreign guests attending the Taipei Security Dialogue 2022 at the Presidential Palace on November 3. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Xi's faction will soon fight each other, CCP will return to instability: Experts

media:group.media:title: Xi's faction will soon fight each other, CCP will return to instability: Experts
media:group.media:description: Xi Jinping is said to have won an absolute victory at the Chinese Communist Party (CCP)'s 20th Congress. All the members of the Standing Committee of the Politburo, the Central Military Commission, and the majority of the Central Committee members belong to Xi's faction. However, experts believe that the internal CCP will soon be divided. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Chinese market goes ‘super bull’ after mysterious screenshot spreads like wildfire

media:group.media:title: Chinese market goes ‘super bull’ after mysterious screenshot spreads like wildfire
media:group.media:description: A screenshot of four paragraphs about a plan to remove the zero-COVID policy and reopen China made the Chinese stock market rise up like a rocket for two days. ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: China’s Tik Tok new privacy policy admits staff can access European, US data

media:group.media:title: China’s Tik Tok new privacy policy admits staff can access European, US data
media:group.media:description:
TikTok informs its European users that their data can be accessed by employees outside Europe, including China, amid political and regulatory concerns about Chinese access to platform user information.
------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights

entry.title: Heroine loses her arm saving 2-year-old boy; Too much or too little water in Shenzhen

media:group.media:title: Heroine loses her arm saving 2-year-old boy; Too much or too little water in Shenzhen
media:group.media:description: 0:00 Woman lost an arm due to sacrificing herself to save a 2-year-old boy 0:55 2 water incidents occurred on the same day in Buji, Shenzhen 1:57 Migrant workers live in steel coils on construction sites in Anhui ------------------- #SpotlightOnChina #China #ChinaInsights
